intro: Antirrhinum ibanyezii, commonly known as the Ibaniez's snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features upright stems and lance-shaped leaves, often growing in rocky or coastal habitats. It is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native region.
